title: [Self-Directed] Introduction to Literate Programming for Earth Observation Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematical knowledge and basic Python programming skills
context.additional_context: Cultivating Problem-Solving Abilities Using Earth Observation Data for Career Preparers in Medical/Legal/Technical Fields

learning_goals: Learners can import atmospheric composition data (temperature, humidity, pressure, etc.) in a Jupyter Notebook environment, perform basic statistical analyses (mean, maximum/minimum values, visualization) using at least three Python libraries (e.g., pandas, numpy, matplotlib), and attach code execution results as screenshots in a report.
Generate documentation with a 3:1 text:code ratio following literate programming principles
Perform preprocessing and visualization of satellite observation data using modularized functions

Within the first three months of a six-month course, learners apply Earth Observation (EO) data to an air pollution analysis project, analyze at least three satellite images, build a pollution concentration prediction model (linear regression), and submit a final report meeting at least four out of five evaluation rubric criteria (including â‰¥80% accuracy).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
